thread.title: Why Customer-Service Reps Should Say ‘I,’ Not ‘We’

author: Alina Dizik
title: Why Customer-Service Reps Should Say ‘I,’ Not ‘We’
text:
“How can we help?” It is the sentence customer-service workers probably utter more than any other. And, according to one study, it has a fatal flaw: They should be saying “I” instead of “we.”
That suggestion runs counter to what sales representatives and other employees who deal with customers have long been trained to do. Don’t use the word “I,” they are told, because it is thought to make the employee sound self-centered. It should be, “How can we help you?” rather than, “How can I help you?”
